question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Status Code Type Safety] Does res.status().as_str() at line 112 always return valid string, or can unknown status codes cause conversion errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Double Ingestion] Can network retries or client bugs cause the same logs to be ingested multiple times if requests are not idempotent, creating duplicate telemetry data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Partial Success Handling] If backend returns non-200 status at line 114 but partially ingested logs, does error handling at line 121 properly indicate this partial failure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Status Code Confusion] Does is_success() check at line 114 properly handle all 2xx codes, or can 202/204 responses from Humio be misinterpreted as failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Error Classification] Does LogIngestError::IngestionError at lines 122 and 132 provide enough context for operators to diagnose backend vs input validation failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Return Value Consistency] Does returning CREATED (201) at line 137 match HTTP semantics when logs are appended to existing data rather than creating new resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Chain Isolation] Can logs from different chain_ids be mixed if chain_id formatting at lines 88-92 produces colliding tag values for different chains? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Cross-Chain Impersonation] Can an attacker with valid credentials on Chain A inject logs tagged as Chain B by manipulating claims.chain_id values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Multi-Chain Context Leak] Does context sharing across chains allow attackers to exploit blacklist or client configuration intended for one chain to affect another chain? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [UnstructuredLog Construction] Can the UnstructuredLog struct at lines 97-101 be manipulated by adding extra fields beyond the documented fields/tags/messages schema? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Field Name Collision] Do field names PEER_ID_FIELD_NAME and EPOCH_FIELD_NAME conflict with any reserved Humio fields, potentially overwriting critical metadata? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Tag Overload] Can attackers send requests that result in excessive tag values at lines 88-95, causing Humio query performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Message Order Preservation] Does the Vec<String> at line 100 guarantee log message ordering matches the original order from nodes, or can reordering occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: log_ingest()] [Node Type Whitelist] Does allowing UnknownValidator and UnknownFullNode at lines 32-33 create security risks where unauthenticated nodes can inject logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: log_ingest()] [Authorization Vector Mutation] Can the vec! of allowed node types at lines 27-33 be modified by concurrent requests, causing inconsistent authorization decisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: log_ingest()] [Context Clone Safety] Does context.clone() at line 26 properly deep-clone security-critical fields like blacklist, or are references shared creating race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Metric Injection] Can attackers manipulate res.status().as_str() at line 112 to inject arbitrary metric labels causing metric cardinality explosion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Unknown Label Accumulation] Does the 'Unknown' label at line 128 accumulate unbounded time-series data if many requests fail, causing metric storage exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Duration Metric Precision] Can elapsed().as_secs_f64() at lines 113, 129 lose precision for very fast or very slow requests, causing incorrect SLA monitoring? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Gzip Header Manipulation] Can attackers send gzip streams with manipulated headers that cause GzDecoder at line 66 to misinterpret compression level or flags? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Truncated Gzip Stream] What happens if gzip stream at line 66 is truncated mid-decompression - does it fail gracefully or leave partial data that gets ingested? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Gzip Trailer Validation] Does GzDecoder validate gzip CRC32 trailer to detect corruption, or can attackers send corrupted compressed data that produces garbage after decompression? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/log_ingest.rs] [Function: handle_log_ingest()] [Multi-Stream Gzip] Can attackers send concatenated gzip streams that cause GzDecoder to only decompress first stream, silently dropping subsequent data? (Low)
